meanings.definition: A person who is lazy and messy.
meanings.sent1: My brother is such a slob, leaving his clothes everywhere.
meanings.sent2: The roommates were all slobs, and the apartment was always untidy.
meanings.sent3: The slob in the office never cleans up after himself, much to everyone's annoyance.
meanings.sent4: The backyard looked like a slob's paradise, with junk scattered all around.
meanings.sent5: The image of a slob is someone who is both lazy and untidy.

meanings.definition: A group of people who are lazy and messy.
meanings.sent1: The slobs at the park left trash everywhere after their picnic.
meanings.sent2: We had to clean up after the slobs who didn't bother to tidy up.
meanings.sent3: The slobs at the party were the last to leave and left a huge mess behind.
meanings.sent4: The slobs in the classroom never picked up their belongings, causing chaos.
meanings.sent5: The image of a group of slobs is one of disorder and laziness.

meanings.definition: To behave in a lazy and messy way.
meanings.sent1: I tend to slob around on weekends, not bothering to tidy up.
meanings.sent2: She always slobbed off her chores onto others, avoiding work.
meanings.sent3: Instead of helping, he chose to slob around and do nothing productive.
meanings.sent4: The students slobbed through the project, resulting in a poorly done presentation.
meanings.sent5: The idea of slobbing around all day seemed appealing to him.
